Title: Energy management
Content:
I've recently been hearing Tim Ferriss talking a few times about how he went from focusing on time management to energy management last year.

I must admit that this resonated quite a lot in my head. My son has *so much* more energy than my wife and I do. And these days I cannot seem to handle any type of schedule outside of work meetings.


But then there is the energy. When your time is limited (it always is), you need to use it wisely.
Then why are you watching that Netflix show you don't like that much when you could start writing on the book you have been thinking about for so long?
Why are you eating that bag of chips when you could easily cook some delicious healthy meal for the week?

Maybe you will tell yourself and others you don't have the motivation to do so. but we all know that motivation isn't reliable. If you want to stick to your plans, you need the energy to fight your inner lazy self. So think just a little bit about how to have more energy.

After that, get to work and show us what you can do!
Excerpt: Is there a point managing anything if you lack the energy to move forward?
